creator: Kenji.Nakamura@cygent.com
text:
When I open the JSP page that includes a sub JSP, and both of them has the
same custom tag, I got a JSP compilation error that complains variables are
already defined in the method. Different values are specified in each tag.

============= Parent.jsp ==================
(snip..)
<cygent:queryList
  id="CustomerHistory"
  className="cygent.domain.customer.Account"
  listRef="acctItemListRef"
  policy="cygent.portal.sb.display.logon.MyHome_AccountPolicy"
/>
(snip..)
<%@ include file="Child.jsp" %>

============ Child.jsp =====================
(snip...)
<cygent:queryList
     id="accountDetailContactList"

className="cygent.portal.sb.display.accountEdit.AccountDetailContactList"
     listRef="accountDetailContactList"

policy="cygent.portal.sb.display.accountEdit.AccountDetailContactListPolicy"
/>
(snip...)

I use the version of Jasper bundled with Websphere Advanced Edition 3.5.2 (i.e 
fixpack 2) and choose Servlet2.2/JSP1.1 compatible mode.

creator: Kenji.Nakamura@cygent.com
text:
The problem was solved by changing include directive from ASP style (<%@ 
include...) to XML style (<jsp:include...). I realized Jasper's behavior is 
right and Weblogic JSP engine doesn't follow JSP spec 2.7.5 strictly.(even if 
ASP style is used, page is parsed dynamically).
